result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Farrell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt (Crime is Class I Felony is Guilty of Class A Misdemeanor) Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges and assessments by 3-27-15, or serve 10 days in the HOC. Defendant may request an extension, and court will grant. ......April 3, 2015; Court orders defendant shall pay at least $50.00 per month with full amount due by 12/01/15.....
Consecutive to: any other sentence with credit for 79 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas J Farrell

defendant.name: Farrell, Nicholas J
defendant.address: W326N6941 North Lake Drive, Hartland, WI 53094

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Granting, request to extend the time to pay fine, costs, and surcharges.  Order signed and filed.  Copy sent to parties.  aw
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Clare L. Fiorenza, Br. 3, for review. jbs
Letter filed by Defendant Nicholas J Farrell.

Received and filed.

Count 1:  Attempt possession of narcotic drugs, contrary to WI Stats sec. 961.41(3g)(am), 939.50(3)(i), 939.32(1)(bm).  A class A misdemeanor.  aw

Defendant Nicholas J Farrell in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Nicholas J Farrell in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  

AS TO THE AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 79 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 79 days time served.  

TIME SERVED DISPOSTION.

- Court ordered defendant to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 3/27/2015, or serve 10 days in the HOC. Defendant may request an extension, and court will grant.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw

Defendant Nicholas J Farrell in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Stephan E. Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 3/27/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court closed on 1-28-2014 due to severe weather.  Case adjourned to Branch 3 on 1-29-2014 at 8:30 am.
COURT ORDERS DEFENDANT REMOVED FROM JUSTICE POINT MONITORING.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail AMENDED TO $750 CASH.

Defendant Nicholas J Farrell in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Nicholas J Farrell in custody. Danielle Chojnacki for Stephan E. Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Nicholas J Farrell in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Nicholas J Farrell in custody.  Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
